title: [Self-Directed] Simulation Education to Enhance Mathematical Interactivity Through Hierarchical Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Instructional Design Theories and Mathematics Education Methodologies
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented course where pre-service teachers design and evaluate interactions with learners in a VR environment.

learning_goals: Applying Gibbonsâ€™ hierarchical design theory, participants can design the control layer for VR simulations in math education.
Participants can analyze interactivity types (learner-content/learner-instructor/learner-learner) and integrate them effectively into VR interfaces.
Participants can iteratively refine interactive instructional scenarios based on formative assessment data.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
